Keywords: Cosmic , Deity , Eternal , Past

Special Powers
TARGETING: Hindering, Adjacent
MILLENIA OF EXPERIENCE AND POWER...: Uni-Mind has PROTECTED: Opposing Probability Control. // When Uni-Mind rolls a single d6 (for Shape Change, Super Sense, etc.), increase the result +1.
...COALESCED INTO PURE FORM: At the beginning of your turn, choose one to use this turn: Close Combat Expert, Range Combat Expert, or Colossal Stamina. // At the beginning of your turn, if Uni-Mind has 2 action tokens, choose one that you didn't choose on your last turn to use this turn: Phasing/Teleport as FREE or Regeneration as FREE.

Maxphyte
I just used this figure and played in a way to specifically test out the 50/50 rollouts. When the rolls succeed, this figure can do a lot. But when the rolls don’t succeed, this figure is way too risky at 300 points lol. Nonetheless still a very fun figure to use in regular games.

December 10, 2021
ClixCommand3r
Quickdraw Clark, just to be clear, Willpower and BOTH pick a powers from the trait are "at the beginning of your turn." So if you start the turn with two action tokens, you should pick Regen or P/T as FREE, then roll Willpower, then pick CS if willpower fails, and CCE or RCE if it succeeds. Even if Willpower succeeds, you will still get to use P/T or Regen as FREE. While their enhanced Regen is pretty exciting, a free P/T during the turn has amazing potential too, given the move and attack on every click and the huge range.
December 10, 2021
Goop
Impervious, BCF, Super Senses, Shape Change, Willpower, Regeneration and even breakaway all get the +1 to her roll. Thats pretty nuts.
